nodes.bodyText: I haven't measured it, but I expect this to get hot and there will only be one implementation at runtime, so the MapAcceptor might not actually get allocated (inlined => scalarised), but it's still smaller than a hashmap and doesn't need resizing if it doesn't work out like that.
Yeah, it would be interesting to see, but I think it is a win either way.
This got backed out in a bad merge (my bad) :(
Move the wrapping here so it can be used without wrapping.

Wasn't sure what synchronized was achieving here. Collections.unmodifiableMap doesn't mutate the map, and prevented it from being mutated. The only caller of this method, DDSpan does not mutate the map. Should the visibility be reduced to package?
This is a new module. I would make it package private if possible

Right, but it doesn't actually make any concurrency guarantees. If the map can only be mutated within critical sections, it will now have been released and any caller can observe the map during critical sections where the map is being mutated. If the map were being copied at this point, synchronized would make sense.
Yes, the getMeta show up in the memory overhead as well, and is creating a lot of unnecessary HashMapNode and HashMapNode[].

As determined by our Idea settings, these finals get automatically added when we save the file: https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-java/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
I'd suggest not trying to change them back, otherwise the next time it gets saved will redo the change.

What I did was rebase on top of your change made to this file after I submitted this PR. I accepted my changes over yours. If you want, I can put the final parameters back in, but would prefer that my editor doesn't make changes without my control.
Odd... why aren't these added to the 0.52.0 section below?
